attributes.action: Run TFL services for the Palestinian Solidarity March
attributes.additional_details: Because the government and the parliament have the power to allow these services to run smoothly
attributes.background: We want the TFL services to run smoothly because it is unjust for the services to be stopped when it comes to the Palestinian Marches. What has happened to freedom of speech?

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about London public transport services are a matter for Transport for London, not the UK Government or Parliament.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
